articles.description: Democracies such as the United States, Italy and Spain, as well as Indonesia, have so far failed to control the spread of the virus.
articles.content:
With more than 3 million people infected with the coronavirus worldwide, the COVID-19 pandemic provides two important and valuable lessons about the link between health research and public policy.

articles.author: David C Gaze, The Conversation
articles.title: Evidence Indicates That Severe Forms of COVID-19 Can Damage The Heart - ScienceAlert
articles.description: People with the most severe forms of COVID-19 are often older and have existing health problems. About 10 percent of COVID-19 patients have heart disease, diabetes and high blood pressure.
articles.content:
People with the most severe forms of COVID-19 are often older and have existing health problems. About 10 percent of COVID-19 patients have heart disease, diabetes and high blood pressure.

articles.author: Charlotte Graham-McLay
articles.title: 'You can't compare': New Zealand looks on Australia's loose lockdown with envy – and horror - The Guardian
articles.description: Both countries have flattened the curve, but New Zealanders wonder if they have paid too high a price compared with Australians
articles.content: Looking across the Tasman at their nearest neighbours Covid-19 elimination measures during their own strict lockdown of the past month, New Zealanders were torn: some complained that Australians were allowed to buy takeaway coffees and get haircuts under some… [+5949 chars]

articles.author: Nick Hansen, James O’Doherty and Danielle Gusmaroli
articles.title: Anglicare fires back over handling of COVID-19 death toll - Gympie Times
articles.description: Anglicare has hit back at Premier Gladys Berejiklian for telling them to “lift their game”, saying family members will be allowed access to their elderly relatives in the stricken Newmarch House nursing home but only if they are in palliative care.

articles.author: Natalie Oliveri
articles.title: The 'mystery' of India's low coronavirus death rate - msnNOW
articles.description: There are close to 30,000 coronavirus infections in India – second only to China in Asia – but the country has recorded just 934 deaths, nearly two months after its first recorded case.
